info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 03 at 7:22PM EDT until July 03 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Spartanburg County in Upstate South Carolina... Southwestern Cherokee County in Upstate South Carolina... North central Union County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 722 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northeast of Spartanburg, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Spartanburg, Pacolet, Cowpens, Jonesville, Pacolet Mills, Cedar Springs, Thicketty, Saratt and Croft State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
